com.nttdocomo.ui
Class Component

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.nttdocomo.ui.Component
Direct Known Subclasses:
Button, ImageLabel, Label, ListBox, TextBox, Ticker, VisualPresenter
public abstract class Component
extends java.lang.Object

This class defines components. The Component class is an abstract class which defines high level API components.

Constructor Summary

          An application cannot directly generate an instance of this class.

Constructor Detail

Component

public Component()
An application cannot directly generate an instance of this class. A component is set to displayable when it is generated by the constructor. To set a component displayable or undisplayable, the setVisible method is used.

Method Detail

setBackground

public void setBackground(int c)
This sets the background color of the component.
The default color is implementation dependent.
When the background color of a visible component is changed, the result shall be reflected immediately.

Parameters:
c - Designates the background color.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Generated when an illegal value is designated for the parameter "c".

setForeground

public void setForeground(int c)
This sets the foreground color of the component.
The default setting is an implementation dependent color contrasting with the background color.
When the foreground color of a visible component, the result shall be reflected immediately.

Parameters:
c - Designates the foreground color.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Generated when an illegal value is set for the parameter "c".

setLocation

public void setLocation(int x,
                        int y)
This sets the component's location.
The location of a component is able to be set only if the layout manager of the panel on which the component is is set as null. The component shall be laid out again and the screen shall be updated by calling this method when the panel on which a component is is displayed.

Parameters:
x - Designates the x-coordinate of the component.
y - Designates the y-coordinate of the component.

setSize

public void setSize(int width,
                    int height)
This sets the component size.
A size larger than the screen size can be designated to the parameter. However, whether or not the component size is adaped to the screen size, ignoring the size designation, is implementation-dependent.
The size can be set at any time. The component shall be laid out again and the screen shall be updated when the panel showing a component is displayed.

Parameters:
width - Designates the component width.
height - Designates the component height.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Generated when a less-than-zero value is designated for either for both of the "width" or "height" parameters.

setVisible

public void setVisible(boolean b)
This sets whether or not to display the component.
The default setting is displayable.
When the setting is made with respect to a component already displayed on the screen, the layout will not be performed again but the screen will be updated. When a component is set to undisplayable, the layout is performed assuming that the component exists there and a blank appears on the screen. When a focused component becomes invisible via this method, it releases the obtained focus and the focus is not obtained by any other components.

Parameters:
b - "true" sets the component as visible and "false" sets it as invisible.
